summary: This document is an email chain from August 25, 2019, between attorney Gloria Allred and an unidentified recipient, discussing urgent travel arrangements for an Epstein victim to attend a court hearing in New York. The communication highlights logistical challenges and confidentiality concerns.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney communicating about travel arrangements for an Epstein victim to attend a hearing in New York. She is the sender/recipient of the emails.

persons.name: Diane
persons.context: Gloria Allred's assistant, who was not working on the day of the email exchange.

connections.description: Diane is identified as Gloria Allred's assistant.
Allred is arranging travel for an Epstein victim to attend a court hearing, indicating a legal representation or advocacy relationship.

events.title: Scheduled Court Hearing in New York
events.description: A hearing related to the Epstein case was scheduled for Tuesday, August 27, 2019, prompting travel arrangements for a victim to attend.

keyFacts: An Epstein victim sought to travel to New York for a court hearing scheduled for Tuesday, August 27, 2019.
Attorney Gloria Allred was actively involved in coordinating urgent travel logistics for the victim, indicating her role in victim advocacy.
The email chain highlights the practical challenges (like child care) faced by victims seeking to participate in legal proceedings.
The correspondence is marked as confidential, emphasizing the sensitive nature of communications regarding victim travel and case details.
